intro: Paradrymonia lacera, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical shrub belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is native to regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its use in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
